programmes.show_description: (2018) Rami Malek turns in an Oscar-winning performance as Freddie Mercury in this rollercoaster musical biopic of the late Queen frontman. Big tunes. Big drama. Bigger teeth.
(1999) Couple Christopher Eccleston and Dervla Kirwin's relationship is tested when her former pen pal, Yvan Attal, turns up in Michael Winterbottom's drama. Strong language/sexual scenes.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(1959) Western starring Henry Fonda. A gunfighter is hired to protect a town from a raiding gang. But a vendetta could undermine him. With Anthony Quinn, Richard Widmark and Dorothy Malone.
(1957) Western starring Randolph Scott and John Carroll. A man seeking revenge for his wife's death tracks his rival down in the sleepy town of Sundown...
(1965) William Whitney's brutal western. Two former Confederate rebels are offered their freedom if they can track, catch or even kill their former gang mates. Starring Audie Murphy.
(1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.
(1993) Romantic comedy with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan. A bereaved man gets another chance at love when his son puts him on a radio talk show.
(2013) All-American action thriller starring Channing Tatum and Jamie Foxx. A Capitol police officer steps up to protect the President when the White House is compromised.
(2018) Action sequel with Benicio Del Toro and Josh Brolin. Two operatives must create a gang war to stop Mexican drug cartels smuggling terrorists into the US.
(2022) Erotic thriller with Kat Graham. Claire gets more than she bargained for when she begins a steamy affair with her boss's wife. But she's got her own dark past too.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(1961) Western starring John Wayne and Stuart Whitman. A Texas Ranger is forced to team up with his prisoner while he's on a covert mission to take on a band of thieves and gunrunners.
(1957) Offbeat melodrama starring Richard Burton (as an RAF officer), Joan Collins (as a nun), Basil Sydney and Cy Grant, who end up on a life raft together after their ship is torpedoed.
(1939) John Ford western with Henry Fonda and Claudette Colbert. In 1776, a settler and his wife attempt to farm in the Mohawk Valley but face attacks from Native Americans and the English.
(1940) Swashbuckling action-adventure starring Tyrone Power. An aristocrat dons his mask and cape to fight for the rights of the poor in 19th-century California. With Basil Rathbone.
(2019) Fourth instalment of the sci-fi comedy franchise with Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Liam Neeson. An alien-obsessed rookie joins London's Men in Black team.
(2013) Thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Johnny Knoxville and Forest Whitaker. A small-town sheriff and his inexperienced staff take on a drug cartel boss who's fleeing to Mexico.
